description: From Mexican Spanish mestengo, from Old Spanish mesteño (“feral animal”) or mestengo (“feral animal”).

entries.meaning: A small, hardy, naturalized (feral) horse of the North American west.
(US, military slang) A merchant marine who joined the U.S. Navy as a commissioned officer during the American Civil War.
examples: He is a product of the merchant marine and is one of the officers called "Mustangs" who entered the navy during the Civil War.

entries.meaning: (US, military slang, generalized) A commissioned officer who started military service as an enlisted person.

verbs.description: mustang (third-person singular simple present mustangs, present participle mustanging, simple past and past participle mustanged)

entries.meaning: (US) To hunt mustangs (wild horses), either for military use or for slaughter as pet food.
